metadata.title: Eurocopter AS350 Écureuil
aws::graph::propositions: # Eurocopter AS350 Écureuil Orders and Operations in China and Brazil
CM International Financial Leasing Corp Ltd is China's first helicopter leasing company.
CM International Financial Leasing Corp Ltd is abbreviated as CMIFL.
CMIFL placed an order for 100 Ecureuil-series helicopters on 9 September 2015.
The 100 Ecureuil-series helicopters ordered by CMIFL are to be a mix of H125 and H130 helicopters.
Brazil has been an extensive operator of the AS350 Écureuil.
More than 300 AS350 Écureuil helicopters were operating in Brazil by 2011.
AS350 Écureuil helicopters operate from the flight deck of the Brazilian aircraft carrier São Paulo.
The Brazilian Navy has used AS350 Écureuil helicopters to support the Brazilian Antarctic Program since 1984.
Helibras is a wholly owned subsidiary of Eurocopter.
Helibras had domestically manufactured 600 helicopters for the Brazilian market by 2012.
70% of the 600 helicopters manufactured by Helibras for the Brazilian market by 2012 were AS350 Écureuils.
Helibras signed a contract with the Brazilian Army in January 2011.
The contract signed by Helibras with the Brazilian Army in January 2011 was to substantially upgrade and refurbish the Brazilian Army's existing fleet of 36 AS350 Écureuils.

text:
On 9 September 2015, China's first helicopter leasing company, CM International Financial Leasing Corp Ltd (CMIFL), placed an order for 100 Ecureuil-series helicopters, these are to be a mix of H125 and H130 helicopters.

Brazil has been an extensive operator of the AS350; by 2011 more than 300 helicopters were operating in the country, including from the flight deck of the Brazilian aircraft carrier São Paulo. Since 1984, the Brazilian Navy has used AS350s to support the Brazilian Antarctic Program. Helibras, a wholly owned subsidiary of Eurocopter, operates in the country; of the 600 helicopters it had domestically manufactured for the Brazilian market by 2012, 70% were AS350s. In January 2011, Helibras signed a contract with the Brazilian Army to substantially upgrade and refurbish their existing fleet of 36 AS350 Ecureuils.
